The method of bathing the Buddha on the eighth day of the fourth month: mix three kinds of fragrant herbs - mugwort, betel, and hemp - and knead them to make a green-colored water;
If the fragrance is insufficient, you can temporarily substitute with indigo, ink, or Qin skin.
Knead turmeric with your hands and soak it in water to make a red water;
If the fragrance is insufficient or unavailable, you can temporarily substitute with facial makeup.
Grind the incense and then soak it to make white water.
If the incense is insufficient, add Chinese talc to it. If you do not have it, you can temporarily replace it with white powder.
Grind the white aconite and then soak it to make yellow water.
If you do not have white aconite, you can temporarily replace it with gardenia.
Black water is black, and the last is pure. Now, the water in the well is called black water.
The above five-colored water is poured as stated in the preface.
After finishing pouring the water for purifying the image, wipe it with white silk or white cotton. Then, pour it again by oneself, and it is called pure pouring.
